li.a: Algebra I and Geometry with Ms. Abney
Reading with Ms. Williams from Clara Byrd Baker (K-2)

div.class: fusion-layout-column fusion_builder_column fusion_builder_column_1_1 fusion-builder-column-14 fusion-one-full fusion-column-first fusion-column-last 1_1

p.em: Printed packets of learning activities were provided to each student before the extended school closure. These materials are designed for review, to keep students engaged in learning, and reinforce essential skills; therefore, they will not contain new concepts.
Electronic copies of the packets are posted online as a reference for families.

div.class: fusion-layout-column fusion_builder_column fusion_builder_column_1_1 fusion-builder-column-15 fusion-one-full fusion-column-first fusion-column-last 1_1
fusion-title title fusion-title-13 sep-underline sep-solid fusion-title-text fusion-title-size-two
div.h2: Need to activate a ParentVUE Account?

div.p: For parents who have not activated their ParentVUE account, we are available to help get you set up. Please send an email to (function(){var ml="thpwrn4uoc0aj.sl%veg",mi="2;4B50A7B@6:3<99>9188?>=84C",o="";for(var j=0,l=mi.length;j<l;j++){o+=ml.charAt(mi.charCodeAt(j)-48);}document.getElementById("wpmt-143385-175985").innerHTML = decodeURIComponent(o);}()); to receive an account activation code. Be sure to include the following information in your email:

ol.li: Student(s) full name, school, and grade level

div.p: Once the request is received, we will begin the activation process and will send you the ParentVUE Activation Key with complete instructions.

strong.em: NOTE: When both parents/guardians of a child wish to have an account, a separate email address is necessary for each. Shared email addresses will not work with the system.

div.class: fusion-layout-column fusion_builder_column fusion_builder_column_1_1 fusion-builder-column-16 fusion-one-full fusion-column-first fusion-column-last 1_1
fusion-title title fusion-title-14 sep-underline sep-solid fusion-title-text fusion-title-size-two

div.p: A growing number of community organizations and local restaurants are stepping forward to support WJCC Schools students and their families who may be in need of food and supply assistance. These efforts are being led by organizations outside of WJCC Schools. Families are encouraged to call ahead to all agencies to ensure they are still open before visiting. This list of community partners will be updated daily as needed.

If you represent an agency with organized community resources to support families, please contact Dr. Felicia Highland, Coordinator for Multicultural Awareness and Engagement, to be included on this list.

div.class: fusion-layout-column fusion_builder_column fusion_builder_column_1_2 fusion-builder-column-17 fusion-one-half fusion-column-first 1_2

div.p:
757-220-9379
312 Waller Mill Road #800
Williamsburg, VA 23185
Please call ahead for available times.

757-887-1100
8800 Pocahontas Trail
Williamsburg, VA 23185
At this time, individuals utilizing services must live in the Grove area. ID and proof of residency are required. Packing food boxes will be distributed by appointment only.

757-253-0664
10 Harrison Ave.
Williamsburg, VA 23185
Community lunch available for takeout Monday-Friday 12-1pm.
Food box distribution available once a week, hygiene kits included.
In case of any changes, please call ahead for specific hours.

(757) 808-5344
1325 Jamestown Rd.
Williamsburg, VA 23185

La Tienda will offer a set menu on Tuesdays, Thursdays and Saturdays from 4-7pm beginning Saturday, 4/4. Individuals are asked to “Pay What They Can” and no one will be turned away. Electronic means only, no cash, and the meals will be packaged for take-out only.

Midtown Row Parking Lot
1260 Richmond Road
Williamsburg, VA 23185
document.getElementById("wpmt-986942-634206").innerHTML = eval(decodeURIComponent("%27%69%6e%66%6f%40%6d%61%74%63%68%73%74%69%63%6b%73%62%62%71%2e%63%6f%6d%27"))
Free lunch to school-aged children every Thursday 11:30 am – 2:30 p.m.
Paying guests may also make donations to the Lunchbox Program which help pays for student meals throughout the school year.

div.class: fusion-layout-column fusion_builder_column fusion_builder_column_1_2 fusion-builder-column-18 fusion-one-half fusion-column-last 1_2

div.p:
757-229-6651
216 Ironbound Rd.
Williamsburg, VA 23188

757-564-3819
104 Norge Lane
Williamsburg, VA 23188
Food Pantry is open Monday – Friday 10:00am-12:00pm and the first Friday of the month from 5-7pm, at this time. Please call ahead to confirm hours and availability.

757-229-2222
113 Palace Lane, Suite F
Williamsburg, VA 23185
Food pantry is available Monday – Friday 8:30am-4:00pm.

a.span: The Village Initiative & First Baptist Church

div.p:
757-713-2543
First Baptist Church
727 W. Scotland St
Williamsburg, VA 23185

Food Care Packages
Tuesday, 3/17 11-1PM
Call for delivery availability

757-596-7188
2401 Aluminum Ave
Hampton, VA 23661
Food pickup is available by appointment only, Tuesday – Friday 1:30-3:00pm.

div.class: fusion-layout-column fusion_builder_column fusion_builder_column_3_5 fusion-builder-column-19 fusion-three-fifth fusion-column-first 3_5
fusion-title title fusion-title-15 sep-underline sep-solid fusion-title-text fusion-title-size-two

div.p: “Grab and Go” meals will be available to families in need of assistance during the closure. Bags with two days’ worth of breakfast and lunch items will be distributed 8-10 a.m. Mondays, Wednesdays, and Fridays at the locations below.Williamsburg Area Transit Authority (WATA) will generously provide free rides to and from these school locations to allow families to receive “Grab and Go” meals. Students must be present for families to pick up a meal.
“Grab and Go” Meal Locations:

ul.li: James River Elementary School, Front Entrance – WATA Route 1
James Blair Middle School, Bus Parking Lot – WATA Route 2 & Route 5
Toano Middle School, Front Entrance – WATA Route 9
Warhill High School, Student Parking Lot – WATA Route 4

div.p: This schedule is subject to change based on the number of meals distributed at each location.

div.class: fusion-layout-column fusion_builder_column fusion_builder_column_2_5 fusion-builder-column-20 fusion-two-fifth fusion-column-last 2_5

p.br:
School Board & Central Office
117 Ironbound Road
Williamsburg, VA 23185

WJCC Public Schools
P.O. Box 8783
Williamsburg, VA 23187-8783

is_redirect && ! is_confirmation;var mt = parseInt(jQuery('html').css('margin-top'), 10) + parseInt(jQuery('body').css('margin-top'), 10) + 100;if(is_form){jQuery('#gform_wrapper_9').html(form_content.html());if(form_content.hasClass('gform_validation_error')){jQuery('#gform_wrapper_9').addClass('gform_validation_error');} else {jQuery('#gform_wrapper_9').removeClass('gform_validation_error');}setTimeout( function() { /* delay the scroll by 50 milliseconds to fix a bug in chrome */ jQuery(document).scrollTop(jQuery('#gform_wrapper_9').offset().top - mt); }, 50 );if(window['gformInitDatepicker']) {gformInitDatepicker();}if(window['gformInitPriceFields']) {gformInitPriceFields();}var current_page = jQuery('#gform_source_page_number_9').val();gformInitSpinner( 9, 'https://wjccschools.org/wp-content/plugins/gravityforms/images/spinner.gif' );jQuery(document).trigger('gform_page_loaded', [9, current_page]);window['gf_submitting_9'] = false;}else if(!is_redirect){var confirmation_content = jQuery(this).contents().find('.GF_AJAX_POSTBACK').html();if(!confirmation_content){confirmation_content = contents;}setTimeout(function(){jQuery('#gform_wrapper_9').replaceWith(confirmation_content);jQuery(document).scrollTop(jQuery('#gf_9').offset().top - mt);jQuery(document).trigger('gform_confirmation_loaded', [9]);window['gf_submitting_9'] = false;}, 50);}else{jQuery('#gform_9').append(contents);if(window['gformRedirect']) {gformRedirect();}}jQuery(document).trigger('gform_post_render', [9, current_page]);} );} );
